availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George McFadden (Louisville, Kentucky, bar keeper and soldier)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, barkeeper and soldier. Indiana native. Barkeeper in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal, sergeant, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant, from August 31, 1861 to June 17, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District, p. 791.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 166.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 560-1.
